page.title: 19The Severn Bridge
page.content: The Severn Bridge is part of the great motorway system of Britain. It carries, the M4, some 3,240 feet across the Severn Estuary from Aust to a point near Chepstow in Gwent , at approximately the same point as the old vehicle ferry known as the "Old Passage". The motorway at this point is two lanes wide in both directions, but frequent repairs often cause delay. The toll gates are to be found on the English side of the bridge. At present it costs 50p for a car to travel in one direction. There are separate lanes for pedestrians and cyclists. The views from the bridge are towards Berkeley and Oldbury to the North, and towards Avonmouth and Portishead to the South.
